com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model

Class SettingsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mpagliaro98.mysubscriptions.model.SettingsManager

  • public class SettingsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to hold application-wide settings. Simply creating a new instance of this class will load the settings from the file and be able to be accessed.

    • Field Summary

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettingsManager

        public SettingsManager(android.content.Context context)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates this class. This will load the settings from the file. If no file exists yet, the default settings will be instantiated and a file containing them will be created.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an error reading or writing to the file

    • Method Detail

      • getNotificationsOn

        public boolean getNotificationsOn()
        Get whether notifications should go off or not.
        Returns:
        the notification setting as a boolean

      • getNotificationTime

        public java.util.Date getNotificationTime()
        Get the time of day notifications should fire at.
        Returns:
        the time of day for notifications as a Date object

      • getCurrencySymbol

        public java.lang.String getCurrencySymbol()
        Get the symbol that should precede currency values.
        Returns:
        the currency symbol as a string

      • getDateFormat

        public java.lang.String getDateFormat()
        Get the format that dates should use.
        Returns:
        the date format as a string

      • setSettings

        public void setSettings(boolean notificationsOn,
                        java.util.Date notificationTime,
                        java.lang.String currencySymbol,
                        java.lang.String dateFormat,
                        android.content.Context context)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the settings to the values that are passed in, then save them all to the file. This should ideally be called when a "save" button is pressed in the settings activity, where all the settings can be gathered from their respective UI elements.
        Parameters:
        notificationsOn - the notification setting as a boolean
        notificationTime - the time of day for notifications as a Date object
        currencySymbol - the currency symbol as a string
        dateFormat - the date format as a string
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an error reading or writing to the file

      • resetToDefaults

        public void resetToDefaults(android.content.Context context)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Resets all the settings to their default values, then overwrites the settings file to save the changes.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there's an error writing to the file

      • deleteSubscriptionData

        public boolean deleteSubscriptionData(android.content.Context context)
        Deletes all subscription data from the application. To do this, this method simply deletes the file containing all subscription data.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Returns:
        true if the delete was successful, false if something went wrong

      • deleteSyncedCalendar

        public void deleteSyncedCalendar(android.content.Context context)
        Checks that synced calendar data exists on the user's system calendar, and if it does, deletes the calendar.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context

      • syncedCalendarExists

        public boolean syncedCalendarExists(android.content.Context context)
        Checks if any synced calendar data exists on the system by running a query to look for calendar data. If calendar permissions aren't granted, this will default to false.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Returns:
        true if a sync calendar was created by this app, false otherwise

      • setDefaults

        private void setDefaults(android.content.Context context)
        Reset the settings to their default values. This does not save over the file.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context

      • loadSettingsFile

        private void loadSettingsFile(android.content.Context context)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Load the settings from the file and save it to this object's fields. Return before any reads if the file does not exist.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there is an issue reading the file

      • saveSettingsFile

        private void saveSettingsFile(android.content.Context context)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Save the settings to the file. This will delete the file and recreate it if it already exists, then write the settings to it.
        Parameters:
        context - the current application context
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there's an error writing the file
